meanings.definition: Not easily bent or shaped; rigid
meanings.sent1: The metal was so unpliable that no amount of force could bend it.
meanings.sent2: The unpliable plastic ruler snapped when I tried to bend it.
meanings.sent3: The unpliable tree branch refused to sway in the wind, standing firm and unmoving.
meanings.sent4: Her unpliable beliefs were like a wall, impossible to change or reshape.
meanings.sent5: The unpliable clay dried into a hard, unyielding shape.

meanings.definition: Not easily influenced or persuaded; stubborn
meanings.sent1: His unpliable attitude made it difficult to convince him to try new things.
meanings.sent2: The unpliable child refused to eat any vegetables, no matter how much his parents insisted.
meanings.sent3: Despite the rain, the unpliable cat adamantly refused to come inside.
meanings.sent4: Her unpliable determination to finish the race was admirable, even in the face of exhaustion.
meanings.sent5: The unpliable rock stood unmoved by the crashing waves, just like his stubbornness.
